message_1: Solve the inequality for x: 2x + 3 < 7 - x.
message_2:
To solve the inequality 2x + 3 < 7 - x, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add x to both sides of the inequality to isolate the x terms on one side.
2x + x + 3 < 7 - x + x

This simplifies to:
3x + 3 < 7

Step 2: Subtract 3 from both sides of the inequality to isolate the x term.
3x + 3 - 3 < 7 - 3

This simplifies to:
3x < 4

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 3 to solve for x.
3x / 3 < 4 / 3

This simplifies to:
x < 4/3

So the solution to the inequality is x < 4/3.
